para.dtcname: Mass Air Flow Circuit Range / Performance Problem

data-name.name: detect-item
data-name.ptxt: Mass Air Flow Circuit Range / Performance Problem

data-name.name: dtc-detect-cond
data-name.ptxt: After the engine is completely warmed up, while the accelerator pedal is released for 7 seconds or more and the vehicle is decelerating, the intake air volume is higher or lower than the threshold* (EGR valve fully closed and throttle valve is fully open).

*: There is a threshold for a low air flow rate malfunction and high air flow rate malfunction. The threshold is different depending on the values of "Engine Speed", "MAP" and "Intake Air Temp (Turbo)".

item.ptxt: Mass air flow meter sub-assembly
Intake air temperature sensor (turbo)
Manifold absolute pressure sensor
Electric EGR control valve assembly
ECM
Open or short in mass air flow meter sub-assembly circuit

Low air flow rate malfunction: For example when vehicle deceleration if "MAF" is 50 gm/sec or less, low air flow malfunction is confirmed (at "Engine Speed" is 1600 rpm, "MAP" is 110 kPa and "Intake Air Temp (Turbo)" is 35째C).

High air flow rate malfunction: For example when vehicle deceleration if "MAF" is 94 gm/sec or more, high air flow malfunction is confirmed (at "Engine Speed" is 1600 rpm, "MAP" is 110 kPa and "Intake Air Temp (Turbo)" is 35째C).
MAF
MAP
Engine Speed
Intake Air Temp (Turbo)
Target EGR Valve Pos
Actual EGR Valve Pos
EGR Close Lrn. Val.
Exhaust Temperature B1S2

atten4.ptxt: If DTC P0101 is stored, either of the following symptoms may appear:

item.ptxt: As the ECU mistakenly determines that there is less air than the actual intake air amount, EGR is decreased to match the target EGR.
Combustion noise worsens
As the ECU mistakenly determines that there is more air than the actual intake air amount, EGR is increased to match the target EGR:
Misfire
White smoke
Black smoke

entry.ptxt: After the engine is completely warmed up, perform the following procedure 3 times: from a vehicle speed of 60 km/h (37 mph), accelerate the vehicle to 80 km/h (50 mph), quickly release the accelerator pedal and do not depress it for 7 seconds or more. After performing the above procedure, immediately stop the vehicle and confirm that "Exhaust Temperature B1S2" display 300째C (572째F) or higher using the GTS.

atten3.ptxt: After replacing the ECM, the new ECM needs registration (Click here ) and initialization (Click here ).

atten4.ptxt: Read freeze frame data using the GTS. Freeze frame data records the engine condition when malfunctions are detected. When troubleshooting, freeze frame data can help determine if the vehicle was moving or stationary, if the engine was warmed up or not, and other data from the time the malfunction occurred.

testgrp.testtitle: CHECK OTHER DTC OUTPUT (IN ADDITION TO DTC P0101)

test1.ptxt: Connect the GTS to the DLC3.
Turn the ignition switch to ON and turn the GTS on.
Enter the following menus: Powertrain / Engine and ECT / Trouble Codes.
Read the DTCs.

gts-info.title: Powertrain > Engine and ECT > Trouble Codes

entry.ptxt: P0101 and other DTCs are output

atten4.ptxt: If codes other than P0101 are output, perform troubleshooting for those DTCs first.

testgrp.testtitle: CHECK FREEZE FRAME DATA (MAF AND ENGINE SPEED)

test1.ptxt: Connect the GTS to the DLC3.
Turn the ignition switch to ON.
Turn the GTS on.
Enter the following menus: Powertrain / Engine and ECT / Trouble Codes.
Check the freeze frame data.

gts-info.title: Powertrain > Engine and ECT > Trouble Codes

item.ptxt: Engine speed 1250 rpm or less
MAF 356.0 gm/sec or more
Engine speed 1250 rpm or more
MAF 1.00 gm/sec or less

testgrp.testtitle: READ VALUE USING GTS (MAF AND ENGINE SPEED)

test1.ptxt: Connect the GTS to the DLC3.
Start the engine and turn the GTS on.
Enter the following menus: Powertrain / Engine and ECT / Data List / MAF and Engine speed.

gts-info.title: Powertrain > Engine and ECT > Data List

test1.ptxt: Start the engine and read the value when 30 seconds has elapsed.

testgrp.testtitle: REPLACE MASS AIR FLOW METER SUB-ASSEMBLY

test1.ptxt: Replace the mass air flow meter sub-assembly.
Click here

atten4.ptxt: If foreign matter is stuck inside the mass air flow meter sub-assembly, the output characteristics of the mass air flow meter sub-assembly may change, resulting in a malfunction.

testgrp.testtitle: CHECK DTC OUTPUT

test1.ptxt: Connect the GTS to the DLC3.
Clear the DTCs.

gts-info.title: Powertrain > Engine and ECT > Clear DTCs

test1.ptxt: Turn the ignition switch off for 30 seconds or more.
Start the engine.

After the engine is completely warmed up, perform the following procedure 3 times with the A/C off: from a vehicle speed of 60 km/h (37 mph), accelerate the vehicle to 80 km/h (50 mph), quickly release the accelerator pedal and do not depress it for 7 seconds or more.
Stop the vehicle immediately after completing the above procedure.
Connect the GTS to the DLC3.
Enter the following menus: Engine and ECT / Data List / Exhaust Temperature B1S2.

item.ptxt: "Exhaust Temperature B1S2" must be 300째C or more.

If "Exhaust Temperature B1S2" and "Exhaust Temperature B2S2" are less than 300째C (572째F), perform the DTC detection drive pattern again, increasing the vehicle speed so that the exhaust gas temperature increases.

test1.ptxt: Enter the following menus: Powertrain / Engine and ECT / Trouble Codes.
Read the pending DTCs.

gts-info.title: Powertrain > Engine and ECT > Trouble Codes

item.ptxt: If no pending DTCs are output, proceed to the next step to check "All Readiness".
Perform the following procedure using the GTS to determine whether or not the DTC judgment has been carried out.

test2.ptxt: Enter the following menus: Powertrain / Engine and ECT / Utility / All Readiness.

atten4.ptxt: If STATUS is INCOMPLETE or N/A, perform the following procedure again 3 times with the A/C off: from a vehicle speed of 60 km/h (37 mph), accelerate the vehicle to 80 km/h (50 mph), quickly release the accelerator pedal and do not depress it for 7 seconds or more.

testgrp.testtitle: CHECK HARNESS AND CONNECTOR (MASS AIR FLOW METER SUB-ASSEMBLY - ECM)

test1.ptxt: Disconnect the mass air flow meter sub-assembly connector.
Disconnect the ECM connector.
Measure the resistance according to the value(s) in the table below.

entry.ptxt: C41-1 (VG) or C39-71 (VG) - Body ground and other terminals

test1.ptxt: Reconnect the mass air flow meter sub-assembly connector.
Reconnect the ECM connector.

testgrp.testtitle: REPLACE ECM

test1.ptxt: Replace the ECM.
Click here

testgrp.testtitle: READ VALUE USING GTS (MAF AND ENGINE SPEED)

test1.ptxt: Connect the GTS to the DLC3.
Turn the ignition switch to ON and turn the GTS on.
Start the engine and warm it up.
Enter the following menus: Powertrain / Engine and ECT / Data List / MAF and Engine speed.

gts-info.title: Powertrain > Engine and ECT > Data List

test1.ptxt: Start the engine and read the value when 30 seconds has elapsed.

testgrp.testtitle: READ VALUE USING GTS (MAP AND ATMOSPHERIC PRESSURE)

test1.ptxt: Connect the GTS to the DLC3.
Turn the ignition switch to ON and turn the GTS on.
Enter the following menus: Powertrain / Engine and ECT / Data List / MAP and Atmospheric Pressure.

gts-info.title: Powertrain > Engine and ECT > Data List

test1.ptxt: Compare the values when the ignition switch is ON.

specitem.ptxt: Difference between "MAP" and "Atmosphere Pressure" is less than 8 kPa.

item.ptxt: If "MAP" and "Atmosphere Pressure" have the same value, both are normal. If there is a difference of 8 kPa or more, compare the values to the atmospheric pressure for that day. The sensor whose deviation is the greatest is malfunctioning.
The standard atmospheric pressure is 101 kPa. For every 100 m increase in altitude, the pressure drops by 1 kPa. This varies by weather.

testgrp.testtitle: CHECK INTAKE SYSTEM

test1.ptxt: Check the intake system for vacuum leakage.
Click here

item.ptxt: Check for abnormal disconnection, pipe and hose squashing, and any damage in the intake system.
Using your hand, check whether the pipes and hoses in the intake system are securely connected.
Air leaks from the intake system can be checked by applying soapy water and revving the engine.
Check for any modifications in the intake system made by the user.

testgrp.testtitle: READ VALUE USING GTS (INTAKE AIR AND INTAKE AIR TEMP [TURBO])

test1.ptxt: Connect the GTS to the DLC3.
Soak the engine for a long time.
Turn the ignition switch to ON and turn the GTS on.
Enter the following menus: Powertrain / Engine and ECT / Data List / Intake Air and Intake Air Temp (Turbo).

gts-info.title: Powertrain > Engine and ECT > Data List

specitem.ptxt: Intake Air is the same as Intake Air Temp (Turbo).

testgrp.testtitle: INSPECT ELECTRIC EGR CONTROL VALVE ASSEMBLY

test1.ptxt: Connect the GTS to the DLC3.
Turn the ignition switch to ON and turn the GTS on.
Enter the following menus: Powertrain / Engine and ECT / Active Test / Control the EGR Step Position.

gts-info.title: Powertrain > Engine and ECT > Active Test

test1.ptxt: When changing the Active Test continuously value to 1, 30, 60, 90, 60, 30 and 1%, check that Actual EGR Valve Pos. smoothly changes to the set opening angle.

specitem.ptxt: Value smoothly changes to set opening angle.

test1.ptxt: Enter the following menus: Powertrain / Engine and ECT / Data List / EGR Close Lrn. Val.

gts-info.title: Powertrain > Engine and ECT > Data List

test1.ptxt: Read the values.

testgrp.testtitle: CHECK HARNESS AND CONNECTOR (MASS AIR FLOW METER SUB-ASSEMBLY - ECM)

test1.ptxt: Disconnect the mass air flow meter sub-assembly connector.
Disconnect the ECM connector.
Measure the resistance according to the value(s) in the table below.

entry.ptxt: C41-1 (FG) or C39-71 (VG) - Body ground and other terminals

test1.ptxt: Reconnect the mass air flow meter sub-assembly connector.
Reconnect the ECM connector.

testgrp.testtitle: REPLACE MASS AIR FLOW METER SUB-ASSEMBLY

test1.ptxt: Replace the mass air flow meter sub-assembly.
Click here

atten4.ptxt: If foreign matter is stuck inside the mass air flow meter sub-assembly, the output characteristics of the mass air flow meter sub-assembly may change, resulting in a malfunction.

testgrp.testtitle: CHECK DTC OUTPUT

test1.ptxt: Connect the GTS to the DLC3.
Clear the DTCs.

gts-info.title: Powertrain > Engine and ECT > Clear DTCs

test1.ptxt: Turn the ignition switch off for 30 seconds or more.
Start the engine.

After the engine is completely warmed up, perform the following procedure 3 times with the A/C off: from a vehicle speed of 60 km/h (37 mph), accelerate the vehicle to 80 km/h (50 mph), quickly release the accelerator pedal and do not depress it for 7 seconds or more.
Stop the vehicle immediately after completing the above procedure.
Connect the GTS to the DLC3.
Enter the following menus: Engine and ECT / Data List / Exhaust Temperature B1S2.

item.ptxt: "Exhaust Temperature B1S2" and "Exhaust Temperature B2S2" must be 300째C or more.
If "Exhaust Temperature B1S2" are less than 300째C (572째F), perform the DTC detection drive pattern again, increasing the vehicle speed so that the exhaust gas temperature increases.

test1.ptxt: Enter the following menus: Powertrain / Engine and ECT / Trouble Codes.
Read the pending DTCs.

gts-info.title: Powertrain > Engine and ECT > Trouble Codes

item.ptxt: If no pending DTCs are output, proceed to the next step to check "All Readiness".
Perform the following procedure using the GTS to determine whether or not the DTC judgment has been carried out.

test2.ptxt: Enter the following menus: Powertrain / Engine and ECT / Utility / All Readiness.

atten4.ptxt: If STATUS is INCOMPLETE or N/A, perform the following procedure again 3 times with the A/C off: from a vehicle speed of 60 km/h (37 mph), accelerate the vehicle to 80 km/h (50 mph), quickly release the accelerator pedal and do not depress it for 7 seconds or more.

testgrp.testtitle: INSPECT ELECTRIC EGR CONTROL VALVE ASSEMBLY

test1.ptxt: Remove the electric EGR control valve assembly.
Click here
Visually check the electric EGR control valve assembly for deposits. If there are deposits, clean the electric EGR control valve assembly.

item.ptxt: When cleaning the electric EGR control valve assembly, make sure the valve is completely closed.
Do not forcibly open the valve, as it may be damaged or deformed.

When cleaning the electric EGR control valve assembly, use a piece of cloth soaked with cleaning solvent. Spraying the solvent directly onto these parts or soaking the parts in the solvent may damage the parts.

test1.ptxt: Hold the electric EGR control valve assembly up to a light, and then from the side indicated by the arrow in the illustration, visually check that there is no gap between the valve and body.

specitem.ptxt: No light passes through (there is no gap between the valve and body).

atten4.ptxt: Light passes through part A shown in the illustration even if the valve is completely closed as there is an opening in the seal ring of the valve, this is not a problem.

test1.ptxt: If light passes through (there is a gap between the valve and body), replace the electric EGR control valve assembly.

testgrp.testtitle: REPLACE MASS AIR FLOW METER SUB-ASSEMBLY

test1.ptxt: Replace the mass air flow meter sub-assembly.
Click here

atten4.ptxt: If foreign matter is stuck inside the mass air flow meter sub-assembly, the output characteristics of the mass air flow meter sub-assembly may change, resulting in a malfunction.

test1.ptxt: Connect the GTS to the DLC3.
Clear the DTCs.

gts-info.title: Powertrain > Engine and ECT > Clear DTCs

test1.ptxt: Turn the ignition switch off for 30 seconds or more.
Start the engine.

After the engine is completely warmed up, perform the following procedure 3 times with the A/C off: from a vehicle speed of 60 km/h (37 mph), accelerate the vehicle to 80 km/h (50 mph), quickly release the accelerator pedal and do not depress it for 7 seconds or more.
Stop the vehicle immediately after completing the above procedure.
Connect the GTS to the DLC3.
Enter the following menus: Engine and ECT / Data List / Exhaust Temperature B1S2.

item.ptxt: "Exhaust Temperature B1S2" must be 300째C or more.

If "Exhaust Temperature B1S2" and "Exhaust Temperature B2S2" are less than 300째C (572째F), perform the DTC detection drive pattern again, increasing the vehicle speed so that the exhaust gas temperature increases.

test1.ptxt: Enter the following menus: Powertrain / Engine and ECT / Trouble Codes.
Read the pending DTCs.

gts-info.title: Powertrain > Engine and ECT > Trouble Codes

item.ptxt: If no pending DTCs are output, proceed to the next step to check "All Readiness".
Perform the following procedure using the GTS to determine whether or not the DTC judgment has been carried out.

test2.ptxt: Enter the following menus: Powertrain / Engine and ECT / Utility / All Readiness.

atten4.ptxt: If STATUS is INCOMPLETE or N/A, perform the following procedure again 3 times with the A/C off: from a vehicle speed of 60 km/h (37 mph), accelerate the vehicle to 80 km/h (50 mph), quickly release the accelerator pedal and do not depress it for 7 seconds or more.

testgrp.testtitle: REPAIR OR REPLACE HARNESS OR CONNECTOR

test1.ptxt: Repair or replace the harness or connector.

testgrp.testtitle: CONFIRM WHETHER MALFUNCTION HAS BEEN SUCCESSFULLY REPAIRED

test1.ptxt: Connect the GTS to the DLC3.
Clear the DTCs.

gts-info.title: Powertrain > Engine and ECT > Clear DTCs

test1.ptxt: Turn the ignition switch off for 30 seconds or more.
Start the engine.

After the engine is completely warmed up, perform the following procedure 3 times with the A/C off: from a vehicle speed of 60 km/h (37 mph), accelerate the vehicle to 80 km/h (50 mph), quickly release the accelerator pedal and do not depress it for 7 seconds or more.
Stop the vehicle immediately after completing the above procedure.
Connect the GTS to the DLC3.
Enter the following menus: Engine and ECT / Data List / Exhaust Temperature B1S2 and Exhaust Temperature B2S2.

item.ptxt: "Exhaust Temperature B1S2" and "Exhaust Temperature B2S2" must be 300째C (572째F) or more.

If "Exhaust Temperature B1S2" and "Exhaust Temperature B2S2" are less than 300째C (572째F), perform the DTC detection drive pattern again, increasing the vehicle speed so that the exhaust gas temperature increases.

test1.ptxt: Enter the following menus: Powertrain / Engine and ECT / Trouble Codes.
Confirm that the pending DTC is not output again.

gts-info.title: Powertrain > Engine and ECT > Trouble Codes
